title: Frank Zappa & The Mothers - Carnegie Hall (1971) 4CD (2010)
description:
Frank Zappa Invades Carnegie Hall, 1971:

â€œCarnegie Hall 1971â€: The complete 7:30 and 11 p.m. shows in this box were recorded by the leader in mono with a single microphone and concealed tape machine (probably to avoid union hassles). 
The fidelity is remarkably clear and full-bodied, even with the inevitable room echo.

Half of the first disc goes to an opening set by the Persuasions, the a cappella do-wop masters recently discovered and recorded by Zappa.

This is also a rare chance to hear the "Flo and Eddie" Mothers' full range of operatic lunacy and underrated small-combo instrumental drive. 
An LP-sized dose, â€œFillmore East â€“ June 1971â€, had been issued shortly before these concerts; another, 1972's â€œJust Another Band from L.A.â€, had just been taped.

â€œCarnegie Hallâ€ marked Zappa's first and last night on that stage. He never left the building.


Frank Zappa & The Mothers Of Invention

Carnegie Hall 1971

2010


4CDs / 2010 / VBR-V0
